page.title: 08EDUCATION IN CODICOTE
page.content: The Sixties style building replaced a Victorian school after an Inspection (1969/70) stated that the school did not meet statutory requirements. The mixed Infant/Junior school has on average 180-200 children divided into 6 classes according to age, plus a Nursery class operating morning and afternoon sessions for 20 children each. There is a staff of 6 teachers plus a half-time Infants teacher and 2 visiting teachers of Music and Science attending for a half day. The Deputy Head, who retired in July, has not yet been replaced because the 40 applicants were not considered of a sufficiently high standard. All except about a dozen pupils stay at school for lunch, about 40% eating school lunches and 60% bringing a packed lunch.
